de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.internalapi

Class APIFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.internalapi.APIFunctions

  • public class APIFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

    Internal API Functions that are used to modify settings in the settings app or to change permissions for selected applications. These functions are only available to the Garment OS settings application since other application shall not be granted to do this kind of modifications. To see real SDK API functions have a look at the APIFunctions class.

    Note 1: Since the implementation of any of these functions do not differ from each other these are no comments added. Each of the following functions works like this. First check whether the connection to the service has been successfully established. If this is not the case a RuntimeExpcetion will be thrown. Otherwise the function call will be redirected to the corresponding handle created in APIHandle and the result in case of a non-void function will be returned to the caller.

    Note 2: These functions will be executed in the application and not the service but will make the service functions being called.

    Note 3: Functions will not execute asynchronously by default. To get this kind of behavior the caller must call the function in a separate Thread.

    Author:
    roehrdor

      • addNewSensor

        public static PSensor addNewSensor(int sampleRate,
                                   int savePeriod,
                                   float smoothness,
                                   java.lang.String displayedSensorName,
                                   SensorType sensorType,
                                   java.lang.String bluetoothID,
                                   MeasurementSystems rawDataMeasurementSystem,
                                   MeasurementUnits rawDataMeasurementUnit,
                                   MeasurementSystems displayedMeasurementSystem,
                                   MeasurementUnits displayedMeasurementUnit)
        Add a new Sensor to the system
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - the sample rate of the sensor
        savePeriod - the save period of the sensor
        smoothness - the smoothness factor to use fot the sensor
        displayedSensorName - the displatyed sensor name
        sensorType - the sensor type
        bluetoothID - the bluetooth id
        rawDataMeasurementSystem - the raw data measurement system
        rawDataMeasurementUnit - the raw data measurement unit
        displayedMeasurementSystem - the displayed measurement system
        displayedMeasurementUnit - the displayed measurement unit
        Returns:
        a sensor object representing the newly added sensor

      • addNewSensor

                                   MeasurementSystems displayedMeasurementSystem,
                                   MeasurementUnits displayedMeasurementUnit)
        Add a new sensor to the system
        Parameters:
        driverID - the driver id to use for the sensor

        sensorType - the sensor type

        rawDataMeasurementSystem - the raw data measurement system
        rawDataMeasurementUnit - the raw data measurement unit
        displayedMeasurementSystem - the displayed measurement system
        displayedMeasurementUnit - the displayed measurement unit
        Returns:
        a sensor object representing the newly added sensor

      • removeSensor

        public static void removeSensor(int sensorID)
        Remove the sensor with the given ID from the system. If the sensor ID provided to this function is invalid nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        sensorID - the sensor ID to be removed
